project.title: Project Settings
project.description: Review the configuration settings currently in use for this project.

experiments.title: Experiments
experiments.description: If you'd like to try out new features that we're working on, you can enable beta features for your project by turning on the experimental features you'd like to try. {0}

experimentalFetchPolyfill.name: Fetch Polyfill
experimentalFetchPolyfill.description: Automatically replaces `window.fetch` with a polyfill that Cypress can spy on and stub. Note: `experimentalFetchPolyfill` has been deprecated in Cypress 6.0.0 and will be removed in a future release. Consider using [`cy.intercept()`](https://on.cypress.io/intercept) to intercept `fetch` requests instead.

experimentalInteractiveRunEvents.name: Interactive Run Events
experimentalInteractiveRunEvents.description: Allows listening to the [`before:run`](https://on.cypress.io/before-run), [`after:run`](https://on.cypress.io/after-run), [`before:spec`](https://on.cypress.io/before-spec), and [`after:spec`](https://on.cypress.io/after-spec) events in plugins during interactive mode.

experimentalSessionSupport.name: Session
experimentalSessionSupport.description: Enable use of [`cy.session()`](https://on.cypress.io/session) and new behavior to handle caching and restoring cookies, localStorage, and sessionStorage.

experimentalSourceRewriting.name: Source Rewriting
experimentalSourceRewriting.description: Enables AST-based JS/HTML rewriting. This may fix issues caused by the existing regex-based JS/HTML replacement algorithm. See [#5273](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/issues/5273) for details.

experimentalStudio.name: Studio
experimentalStudio.description: Generate and save commands directly to your test suite by interacting with your app as an end user would. See [Cypress Studio](https://on.cypress.io/studio) for more details.

device.title: Device Settings
device.description: Review the configuration settings currently in use for this device.

testingPreferences.title: Testing Preferences
testingPreferences.description: Configure your testing environment with these flags

footer.text: You can reconfigure the settings for this project if you're experiencing issues with your Cypress configuration.

notfound.title: Couldn't find your project
notfound.description: We were unable to find an existing project matching the {0} set in your Cypress config file. You can reconnect with an existing project or create a new project.

unauthorized.title: Request access to view the recorded runs
unauthorized.description: This is a private project that you do not current have access to. Please request access from the project owner in order to view the list of runs.

unauthorizedRequested.title: Your access request for this project has been sent.
unauthorizedRequested.description: The owner of this project has been notified of your request. We'll notify you via email when your access request has been granted.

e2e.name: E2E Testing
e2e.description: Build and test the entire experience of your application from end-to-end to each ensure each flow matches your expectations.

component.name: Component Testing
component.description: Build and test your components from your design system in isolation in order to ensure each state matches your expectations.

renameAuto.title: We'll automatically rename your specs in this step
renameAuto.changedSpecFolder: We've changed the default spec folder from:
renameAuto.changedSpecExt: We've changed the default spec file extension from:
renameAuto.changedSpecPatternExplain: We've made the default spec file extension to {0} in order to avoid conflicts with any existing testing frameworks.
renameAuto.optedOutMessage: You've opted not to rename your spec file extension

modals.title: Change the existing spec file extension

step1.warning: We recommend using the default extension to avoid inconsistencies, framework conflicts, and confusion with your team.
step1.line1: Cypress now supports the ability to create new spec files from within the UI for both E2E and component specs.
step1.line2: All new spec files created within Cypress will use the default pattern of:
step1.line3: We want to rename your existing specs so that they have a consistent filename pattern for both E2E and component testing.
step1.line4: We've changed the placement of component specs to be next to their source files (e.g. src/Button.jsx and src/Button.cy.jsx)
step1.line5: The new default pattern of {0} prevents targeting conflicts with other testing frameworks. (e.g. Jest)
step1.buttonProceed: I still want to change the spec file extension

step2.warning: You may need to change your specPattern later if you don't use the recommended filename extension.
step2.label: Choose from the following filename patterns:
step2.option2: Don't rename anything — keep what I have.

renameManual.title: We need you to move your component specs manually
renameManual.componentFolderRemoved: We've removed the {0} options from the Cypress config.
renameManual.addedSpecPattern: We've added a new {0} option in the Cypress config that tells us where to find your component specs.
renameManual.cannotAuto: We can't automatically migrate your existing component spec files. We recommend that you move the following component spec files next to your source component files (e.g. {0})
renameManual.ifSkipNote: If you skip this step, Cypress will still be able to find them, but any new specs that you create will automatically be created next to your component files.

renameSupport.title: We'll automatically rename your existing E2E support file in this step
renameSupport.serveDifferentTypes: We now serve different support files for E2E and component testing.
renameSupport.changedSupportFile: We've renamed the E2E support file from:

configFile.title: We need to move the Cypress configuration file
configFile.changedDefault: We've changed the default Cypress config file from:
configFile.customOptions: We've set a custom {specPattern} option based on your {options}.
configFile.willConvert: We'll automatically create a new {jsFile} file and seed it with your options from your existing {jsonFile}.

setupComponent.title: You need to reconfigure Cypress for component testing
setupComponent.line1: We've detected that you are currently using the experimental version of component testing.
setupComponent.line2: Your existing configuration is no longer compatible with new component testing configuration options.
setupComponent.line3: In a previous step, we renamed your component specs, but can't automatically migrate your existing component testing configuration.
setupComponent.line4: In the next screen, you'll be able to reconfigure component testing in a new guided configuration wizard.

wizard.title: Migration Helper
wizard.description: Complete the steps below to migrate your project to Cypress 10

step1.title: Automatically rename existing specs
step1.description: In this step, we'll automatically rename and move your existing spec files.

step2.title: Manually move your existing component specs
step2.description: In this step, you'll manually move your existing component specs to their new default location.
step2.buttonWait: Waiting for you to move your component specs...
step2.buttonDone: I have moved my component specs

step3.title: Rename the Cypress support file
step3.description: In this step, we'll automatically rename your existing support file.
step3.button: Rename the support file for me

step4.title: Automatically migrate the Cypress configuration file
step4.description: In this step, we'll automatically migrate your existing cypress configuration to the new Cypress configuration file.

step5.title: Reconfigure component testing
step5.description: In this step, we'll explain how you will reconfigure Cypress for component testing.
